p: Hepatitis G virus (HGV) was discovered incidentally and was named after a 35-year-old surgeon who developed jaundice. His serum led to the identification of GBV-A, GBV-B, and GBV-C. Subsequent studies have not identified any association between infections with GBV or acute hepatitis. Therefore, the term hepatitis G virus has been questioned. It is a positive-strand RNA virus belonging to the Flaviviridae family and GB V-C shares 27 % homology with HCV [ 155].
